intro: Scaphopetalum pallidinerve, commonly known as the pale-veined scaphopetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a pale midrib. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and stamens that are often longer than the petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
